verses.roman:
śrī-śuka uvāca
athānyad api kṛṣṇasya
śṛṇu karmādbhutaṁ nṛpa
krīḍā-nara-śarīrasya
yathā saubha-patir hataḥ

synonyms: śrī-śukaḥ uvāca—Śukadeva Gosvāmī said; atha—now; anyat—another; api—yet; kṛṣṇasya—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; śṛṇu—please hear; karma—deed; adbhutam—wonderful; nṛpa—O King; krīḍā—for playing; nara—humanlike; śarīrasya—whose body; yathā—how; saubha-patiḥ—the lord of Saubha (Śālva); hataḥ—killed.
translation: Śukadeva Gosvāmī said: Now please hear, O King, another wondrous deed performed by Lord Kṛṣṇa, who appeared in His humanlike body to enjoy transcendental pastimes. Hear how He killed the master of Saubha.
